title: Is it a snobbish thing if someone says, 'Hi, (your name)' and you only say 'Hi'? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes. I remember simply extending as courtesy and being rebuffed. Yes I think it is impolite. I know people have other things on their mind and might not welcome someone impolitely intruding into their affairs but I think it's rude to completely ignore the person. Although I can sympathize. Some people I guess simply are snobbish. I guess that's something we all have to address.

Uh oh, you forgot someone's name. What do you do now. Keep talking about how long it has been since you have seen them and bla, bla, bla what were we talking about and maybe, just maybe they will catch on and say “yes, just the other day I was saying to myself, John, it's been a long time since we've seen Tom. I wonder what he's doing. Last I remember we were talking about firetrucks.”
